Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

Unbelievably, the Illinois State House today is holding a hearing on reviving the death penalty in Illinois. It feels like we have turned back the clock to a very dark time in our state's history.

Tell your state representative to reject reviving the death penalty in Illinois.

Over seven years ago, we took a major step forward — passing legislation to end the use of capital punishment. That legislation was the end result of years of mounting evidence that the death penalty in Illinois was flawed, racially-biased and ineffective. The scene of an innocent person being released from death row — for a crime they did not commit — became common place.

Last week, ignoring this sad history, Illinois Governor Bruce Rauner used an amendatory veto to write this ineffective system back into law. The legislature has written this idea into a proposal and may even vote on the matter as soon as this week.

Illinois has seen the harm that a flawed death penalty system can do, all while adding nothing to enhance public safety. Suggesting a return to this failed policy is must be rejected.

Tell your state representative to reject reviving the death penalty in Illinois.

Sincerely,

Colleen K. Connell
Executive Director
ACLU of Illinois
